returns.isClean: True if the merge completed without conflicts.
returns.mergeId: The merge session ID (zero if clean).
returns.result: The merge result (populated only for clean merges).

params.contentTypes: The content types this strategy supports (stored off-chain).
params.name: The strategy name.

returns.strategyId: The unique identifier for the strategy.

params.conflictIndex: The index of the conflict to resolve.

returns.remaining: The number of unresolved conflicts remaining.

finalize(bytes32).notice: Finalizes a merge session after all conflicts are resolved.

merge(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Performs a three-way merge. Returns clean result if one side is unchanged,         otherwise creates a merge session with conflicts.

resolveConflict(bytes32,uint256,bytes).notice: Resolves a specific conflict in a merge session.
